text: Dame Tariana Turia (née Woon; 8 April 1944 – 3 January 2025) was a New Zealand Māori rights activist and politician. She was first elected to Parliament in 1996 as a member of the Labour Party. In 2002, she was re-elected to parliament as a member of the Māori Party. From 2004 to 2014, Turia was the Co-leader of the Māori Party. Turia died in Whangaehu, New Zealand on 3 January 2025, at the age of 80, after having a stroke. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2025 deaths Category:New Zealand politicians Category:Deaths from stroke Category:New Zealand activists
title: Tariana Turia
